docs.abstract: The beverage company apologized for an ad featuring Kendall Jenner giving a smiling officer a soda at a protest.
docs.snippet: The beverage company apologized for an ad featuring Kendall Jenner giving a smiling officer a soda at a protest.
docs.lead_paragraph: Pepsi has apologized for a controversial advertisement that borrowed imagery from the Black Lives Matter movement, after a day of intense criticism from people who said it trivialized the widespread protests against the killings of black people by the police.

headline.main: Pepsi Pulls Ad Accused of Trivializing Black Lives Matter
headline.print_headline: Pepsi Drops Ad Accused of Trivializing Protesters

docs.abstract: It’s no surprise that co-opting a cause for marketing went terribly wrong.
docs.snippet: It’s no surprise that co-opting a cause for marketing went terribly wrong.
docs.lead_paragraph: Pepsi on Wednesday pulled a disastrous advertisement after it was met with widespread ridicule. Titled “Jump In,” the two-and-a-half minute spot was full of clumsy, glib references to police brutality and Black Lives Matter protests. Nearly every tone-deaf frame has become a mocking meme. And the commercial (Pepsi calls it a “short film”) drew the most intense disgust from the very people whose experiences it tried to reflect.

headline.main: A Pepsi Commercial’s Lesson for Advertisers

docs.abstract: In 1997, the Justice Department entered its first consent decree, with the Pittsburgh police. Nineteen cities later, it has learned from its mistakes.
docs.snippet: In 1997, the Justice Department entered its first consent decree, with the Pittsburgh police. Nineteen cities later, it has learned from its mistakes.
docs.lead_paragraph: PITTSBURGH — Federal intervention to curb police abuse did not begin after chants of “I can’t breathe,” viral cellphone videos or the Black Lives Matter movement.

headline.main: ‘It Did Not Stick’: The First Federal Effort to Curb Police Abuse
headline.print_headline: The Rise and Fall of Federal Efforts to Curb Police Abuse
